title: FOIA Request for Case-Related Materials - Skyler Vanhouten, Mason Thompson-Bray

communications.subject: Wisconsin Open Records Act Request: FOIA Request for Case-Related Materials - Skyler Vanhouten, Mason Thompson-Bray
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Wisconsin Open Records Act, I hereby request the following records:

To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Ohio Open Records Law, I hereby request the following records:

I am writing to formally request access to public records under the Freedom of Information Act (FOIA). Specifically, I am requesting any and all records and materials related to the case of

Suspect Name: Skyler Vanhouten
Description/Headline: 2 Columbus-area men who blame each other for deadly robbery get 56 yrs to life sentences
Link of the Article: https://eu.dispatch.com/story/news/courts/2024/01/24/franklin-county-judge-gives-2-men-long-sentences-in-deadly-robbery-double-murder-in-prairie-township/72315804007/
State: Wisconsin
Law Enforcement: franklin pd 

included but not limited to the following:
Documents:
Incident reports
Investigation reports
Officer statements
Witness statements
Any other relevant case files

Footage:
Body camera footage from officers on the scene
Dash camera footage
Police surveillance camera footage
Private/public surveillance footage from nearby locations
Any footage collected as evidence or during the investigation

Audio:
911 calls
Police radio communications
Any other audio recordings related to the case
Visual Media:
Crime scene photographs
Surveillance stills
Photographs taken during the investigation

Court Records:
Transcripts from court hearings or proceedings
Any video/audio footage from court hearings
Court orders or any other court-related documents

Please include any and all materials, regardless of format (digital or physical), including those not listed above that are related to the case in question.
Additionally, if this request has been sent to the wrong department or agency, I would appreciate it if you could provide guidance or contact information for the correct department or agency that handles such requests.

If any part of the request is denied or redacted, please provide a detailed explanation of the specific legal exemption that applies.
Thank you for your attention to this matter. I look forward to your timely response within the period mandated by FOIA.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 10 business days.

Sincerely,

david yupa

communications.subject: New Mexico Inspection of Public Records Act Request: ICE requests-NM (Rio Rancho Public Schools)
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the New Mexico Inspection of Public Records Act, I hereby request the following records:

1) By school, the number of student incident reports forwarded or otherwise provided to the New Mexico All Source Intelligence Center and/or Immigration and Customs Enforcement between September 1, 2020 and present; 

1a) and any such reports with student names redacted.

2) All documents indicating, reflecting or referencing any policies, processes, practices, guidance, directives, memoranda and/or recommendations regarding your school district generating, sending and/or transmitting school district documents to any divisions, employees, and/or agents of New Mexico All Source Intelligence Center and/or Immigration and Customs Enforcement between September 1, 2020 and present.

3) all documents received from and/or generated by your school district and sent to, transmitted to, or otherwise made available or accessible to the New Mexico All Source Intelligence Center  and/or Immigration and Customs Enforcement and/or any of their employees or agents between Sept 1 2020 and the present;

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 15 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Marina Villeneuve

title: Murder Investigations of Parler W Edwards and Ernest Jones (Office of the Attorney General - New York)

communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the New York Freedom of Information Law, I hereby request the following records:

Documents related to the murder investigations of 71-year-old Parler W. Edwards and 40-year-old Ernest Jones. The murders occurred on October 8th and 9th, 1980 in or near Buffalo, New York. The murders were investigated as part of a task force by the Buffalo Police Department, New York State Police Department, Erie County Sheriff's Office, Cheektowaga Sheriff's Office, Town of Tonawanda Police Department, Erie County District Attorney's Office and the Federal Bureau of Investigation (FBI), among others.

I kindly request the disclosure of the following information and records, including but not limited to:
- Autopsy reports of both victims
- Investigation records, including case files, incident reports, and evidence logs
- Audio recordings related to the investigation, such as 911 calls, police radio transmissions, and interviews
- Phone logs and transcripts pertaining to communication between individuals involved in the case
- Interview records, including transcripts, summaries and notes from interviews conducted with witnesses, suspects, and persons of interest
- DNA reports and analysis results related to the crime scene and evidence collected
- Letters, correspondence, and written communications associated with the investigation
- Photographs depicting the crime scene, victims, suspects, and evidence
- Notes, memoranda and internal communications related to the investigation, including relevant inter-agency communications

Further, I request that the scope of this FOIA request includes any records generated by the .22-Caliber Task Force, which investigated the killings.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 5 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Brett Michael Battaglia-Szyjka

title: Anita Jane Bryant (March 25, 1940 – December 16, 2024)

communications.subject: Freedom of Information Act Request: Anita Jane Bryant (March 25, 1940 – December 16, 2024)
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Freedom of Information Act, I hereby request the following records:

Records mentioning, relating to, or generated as a result of investigation or inquiry into singer and anti-gay activist Anita Jane Bryant (March 25, 1940 – December 16, 2024). Her death is widely-known and widely reported; as such, privacy concerns under FOIA Exemptions 6 and 7 are voided, as are any concerns under the Privacy Act. For example, you may find his New York Times obituary at the following link: https://www.nytimes.com/2025/01/09/arts/music/anita-bryant-dead.html

Please conduct a search of the Central Records System, including but not limited to the Electronic Surveillance (ELSUR) Indices, the Microphone Surveillance (MISUR) Indices, the Physical Surveillance (FISUR) Indices, and the Technical Surveillance (TESUR) Indices, for both main-file records and cross-reference records of both HQ and all field offices for all relevant names, agencies, organizations, companies and events including but not limited to those cited in the previous paragraphs and/or links as well as a cross-reference with the Southern Poverty Law Center to include any information provided by the SPLC. My request includes but is not limited to 137, 157, 176, 177, 183, 184, 188, and 214 files. If previously released records are available, then I request a rolling release consisting of those records while additional records are located and processed for release.

If any part of these documents are exempt from disclosure, please be sure to review and release all reasonably segregable nonexempt portions of responsive documents, as the FOIA requires.

I request that I be properly classified as a media requester. I am an assistant editor at Reason Magazine who has written numerous articles on topics of public interest, and I am requesting these documents in an editorial capacity. Please contact me if you have any questions about my media status.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 20 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Matthew Petti

title: Michigan State Capitol ZeroEyes Data

communications.subject: Michigan Freedom of Information Act Request: Michigan State Capitol ZeroEyes Data
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Michigan Freedom of Information Act, I hereby request the following records:

1) The contract entered into on or around November 20, 2023, including the price and dates, between the Michigan state capitol and ZeroEyes for use of ZeroEyes’ artificial intelligence gun detection software;

2) Any records showing the number of times the ZeroEyes software has raised an alert between its implementation on or around November 20, 2023 and the present; and

3) Any records documenting false positive or false negative alarms raised by the ZeroEyes software during the same period, where a false positive is defined as an event in which the system incorrectly identified a non-weapon object as a weapon and a false negative is defined as an event in which the system failed to detect a weapon.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 5 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Maggie Dougherty

title: Dumitrascu Records

communications.subject: Freedom of Information Act Request: Dumitrascu Records
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Freedom of Information Act, I hereby request the following records:

CBP database entries, communications, reports of investigation, or other records pertaining to Cristian Dumitrascu. CBP apprehended Mr. Dumitrascu on or around February 22, 2023, near the Otay Mesa POE for alleged involvement in alien smuggling activity and for allegedly admitting to illegal entry into the U.S. on or around September 1, 2019. Mr. Dumitrascu was apparently in CBP custody from the date of his arrest through March 1, 2023, when ICE took custody. He died five days later at the Otay Mesa Detention Center. https://www.ice.gov/doclib/foia/reports/ddrCristianDumitrascu.pdf.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 20 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Andrew Free

title: Richard Secord (Federal Bureau of Investigation)

communications.communication:
Dear FOIA Staff:

Please produce all records related to General Richard Vernon Secord, who pleaded guilty to a felony for lying to Congress about the Iran-Contra Affair. 

General Secord was born on 6 July 1932 in LaRue, Ohio, USA. He died on 15 October 2024.

I request that all fees related to this request be waived. Gen. Secord was a high-ranking Air Force officer and a public figure due to his involvement in the Iran-Contra Affair. News obituaries for Gen. Secord appeared in numerous national news media. His obituary from the Washington Post is attached, as proof of both his death and of his status as a public figure. I have no commercial interest in this request, and I will make all responsive records available to the general public online for free.

Sincerely,

Nicholas Marritz

title: FOIA Request for Case-Related Materials - Geoffrey Gaston.

communications.subject: Florida Sunshine Law Request: FOIA Request for Case-Related Materials - Geoffrey Gaston.
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Florida Sunshine Law, I hereby request the following records:

I am writing to formally request access to public records under the Freedom of Information Act (FOIA). Specifically, I am requesting any and all records and materials related to the case of

Suspect Name: Geoffrey Gaston. 
Description/Headline: Orlando Man Who Committed Five Armed Robberies Sentenced To Seven Years In Federal Prison
Link of the Article: https://www.justice.gov/usao-mdfl/pr/orlando-man-who-committed-five-armed-robberies-sentenced-seven-years-federal-prison
State: Orlando, Florida
Law Enforcement: Orlando Police Department

included but not limited to the following:
Documents:
Incident reports
Investigation reports
Officer statements
Witness statements
Any other relevant case files

Footage:
Body camera footage from officers on the scene
Dash camera footage
Police surveillance camera footage
Private/public surveillance footage from nearby locations
Any footage collected as evidence or during the investigation

Audio:
911 calls
Police radio communications
Any other audio recordings related to the case
Visual Media:
Crime scene photographs
Surveillance stills
Photographs taken during the investigation

Court Records:
Transcripts from court hearings or proceedings
Any video/audio footage from court hearings
Court orders or any other court-related documents

Please include any and all materials, regardless of format (digital or physical), including those not listed above that are related to the case in question.
Additionally, if this request has been sent to the wrong department or agency, I would appreciate it if you could provide guidance or contact information for the correct department or agency that handles such requests.

If any part of the request is denied or redacted, please provide a detailed explanation of the specific legal exemption that applies.
Thank you for your attention to this matter. I look forward to your timely response within the period mandated by FOIA.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 10 business days.

Sincerely,

david yupa

title: Crime Data Records Request

communications.subject: Georgia Open Records Act Request: Crime Data Records Request
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Georgia Open Records Act, I hereby request the following records:

1. Offense Level Data
Please provide offense level data for incidents occurring within a one-mile radius 599 East Jule Peek Ave, Cedartown, GA, during the period of December 31, 2021, through December 31, 2024. The data should include, at a minimum, the following fields: Incident number, Occurrence date, Occurrence time, Reported date, Reported time, Offense description, UCR/NIBRS code, Other offense code/statutes (where applicable), Address (if possible, original address not aggregated to block level), Business/location name if available, Latitude, Longitude.

I request that this data be provided in CSV, XLS, or XLSX format.

2. CFS Level Data
Please provide call-for-service (CFS) data for calls within a one-mile radius of 599 East Jule Peek Ave, Cedartown, GA, during the period of December 31, 2021, through December 31, 2024. The data should include, at a minimum, the following fields: Call number, Call date, Call time, Call type (if coded, please include code definitions), Call type description (if coded, please include code definitions), Disposition (No Action Taken, Gone Upon Arrival, etc.), Address (if possible, original address not aggregated to block level), Business name (where applicable), Beat, Latitude, Longitude.

I request that this data be provided in CSV, XLS, or XLSX format.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 3 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Karli DeBlois

communications.subject: Texas Public Information Act Request: Sally Mann artwork seized by police -- Judge Tim O'Hare
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Texas Public Information Act, I hereby request the following records:

1. Any communications sent to or from Tim O'Hare on or after December 1, 2024, which concerns or mentions the Modern Art Museum of Fort Worth, including (but not limited to) any communications containing any of the following terms: Museum, Sally, Mann, pornography, porn, indecent, decent, decency.

2. Any communications between Tim O'Hare and the Modern Art Museum of Fort Worth on or after December 1, 2024.

Please note that this request seeks public records wherever they may be found, including on devices or networks owned or operated by private parties. For example, if an employee uses a personal cell phone or social media account to conduct public business, records created, maintained, or held on the phone or account are public records subject to this request.

"Communications" means and includes emails, text messages, social media messages, letters, memoranda, calendar entries, chats, or any other form of one-to-one or one-to-many communication.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 10 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Adam Steinbaugh

title: Ricardo Carreon Open Record Request

communications.subject: Texas Public Information Act Request: Ricardo Carreon Open Record Request
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Texas Public Information Act, I hereby request the following records:

I am submitting this letter in order to request all documents, public information and public records related to Case ID 24001957, described below.  Please be advised that this request is hereby submitted pursuant to The Texas Open Records Act, Texas Government Code Chapter 552, and The Federal Freedom of Information Act.  I would like to request that all such public information and records be produced as soon as possible.  Please be advised that your agency will be paid the requisite fees, in accordance with the Open Records Act, with respect to your compliance with this request for the production of public records and documents.

Our office represents Ricardo Carreon in regard to injuries he sustained in an accident  on November 22, 2024 at approximately 06:41 AM.  The location of the accident was 2000 57th Street in Temple TX.  The public information and documents which I am requesting at this time (including information that is collected, assembled, or maintained under a law or ordinance or in connection with the transaction of official business by or for a government body, which included the media on which the public information is recorded, paper, film, magnetic, optical, and/or solid state device that can store an electronic signal; tape; computer disk; etc.) are as follows:

•	Any video or photographs taken at the scene of the collision, in the officer’s cruiser, or by responding officers bodycam,

•	Any witness statements, handwritten notes, or supplemental accident report information, 
 

•	An audio copy of the 911 calls from witnesses who called in to report this accident, along with any witness names, addresses, and phone numbers that may be in possession of the communications center, along with any police reports that correspond to this particular incident. 

•	Copies of all sketches, diagrams, witness statements and/or names and phone numbers of witnesses at the scene who did not give statements that may be in the possession of your department.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 10 business days, as the statute requires.

title: City Storage Program Policy documentation

communications.subject: Massachusetts Public Records Law Request: City Storage Program Policy documentation
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Massachusetts Public Records Law, I hereby request the following records:

Any documents pertaining to the "City Storage Program Policy" as described by "An Ordinance to amend Ch. 24 by adding a new section relative to Camping" section 24-31(g)(i): "The Salem Police Chief shall establish, and from time to time amend, a City Storage Program Policy not inconsistent with this ordinance." Including current and prior versions of the written copy of the "City Storage Program Policy" as pursuant to 24-31(g)(v), any amendments to the current written copy of the "City Storage Program Policy", and any notes kept regarding the current written copy of the "City Storage Program Policy" from the Salem Police Department since the establishment of "An Ordinance to amend Ch. 24 by adding a new section relative to Camping" to the date this request was sent, January 13, 2025.

As well as,

All documents from the June 26, 2024 dispersal of the 'South River encampment' pertaining to "reasonable and documented attempts" made by "City staff" to identify owners of "property" that was left at the South River encampment as a result of this June 26 dispersal that was "not claimed by any person within 24 hours of it being deemed by the City as being unclaimed" in which case "City staff" are to "assess whether the property is abandoned property or an individual’s temporarily unattended property through reasonable and documented attempts to identify the property owner" as is required of the "City Storage Program Policy" pursuant to 24-31(g)(iii).

I also request that, if appropriate, fees be waived as we believe this request is in the public interest, as suggested but not stipulated by the recommendations of the Massachusetts Supervisor of Public Records. I am currently a student journalist at Emerson College and have reported about the South River encampment in the past. As these records pertain to the transparency of our public officials in the treatment of homeless community members on public grounds, I would request the fees for this request be waived on the grounds of clear public interest as is suggested by the Massachusetts Supervisor of Public Records. As section 24-31(g)(vii) lays out how fees should not be charged in regards to processing claims in filing appeals to recover property pursuant to the "City Storage Program Policy," I would ask that this standard be extended to this request as it is not made in the commercial interest but in the interest of transparency regarding the same policy. The requested documents will be made available to the general public free of charge as part of the public information service at MuckRock.com, and will not be made for commercial usage.

I expect the request to be filled in an accessible format, including for screen readers, which provide text-to-speech for persons unable to read print. Files that are not accessible to screen readers include, for example, .pdf image files as well as physical documents.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 10 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Adam Nuñez

title: FOIA Request for Case-Related Materials - Brooks Cleary

communications.subject: Georgia Open Records Act Request: FOIA Request for Case-Related Materials - Brooks Cleary
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Georgia Open Records Act, I hereby request the following records:

I am writing to formally request access to public records under the Freedom of Information Act (FOIA). Specifically, I am requesting any and all records and materials related to the case of

Suspect Name: Brooks Cleary
Description/Headline: ‘She didn’t get justice’: Man who said girlfriend died from seizure after she had been shot in the head with shotgun gets 11 years 
Link of the Article: https://lawandcrime.com/crime/she-didnt-get-justice-man-who-said-girlfriend-died-from-seizure-after-she-had-been-shot-in-the-head-with-shotgun-gets-11-years/
State: Marietta, Georgia 
Law Enforcement: Cobb County Police Department

included but not limited to the following:
Documents:
Incident reports
Investigation reports
Officer statements
Witness statements
Any other relevant case files

Footage:
Body camera footage from officers on the scene
Dash camera footage
Police surveillance camera footage
Private/public surveillance footage from nearby locations
Any footage collected as evidence or during the investigation

Audio:
911 calls
Police radio communications
Any other audio recordings related to the case
Visual Media:
Crime scene photographs
Surveillance stills
Photographs taken during the investigation

Court Records:
Transcripts from court hearings or proceedings
Any video/audio footage from court hearings
Court orders or any other court-related documents

Please include any and all materials, regardless of format (digital or physical), including those not listed above that are related to the case in question.
Additionally, if this request has been sent to the wrong department or agency, I would appreciate it if you could provide guidance or contact information for the correct department or agency that handles such requests.

If any part of the request is denied or redacted, please provide a detailed explanation of the specific legal exemption that applies.
Thank you for your attention to this matter. I look forward to your timely response within the period mandated by FOIA.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 3 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

david yupa

communications.subject: Police Records Request :: P000187-011325
communications.communication:
Dear david yupa: 
Thank you for your interest in public records of City of Lubbock. Your request has been received and is being processed in accordance with Chapter 552 of Texas Government Code, the Public Information Act. Your request was received in this office on 1/13/2025 and given the reference number P000187-011325 for tracking purposes. Records Requested: To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Texas Public Information Act, I hereby request the following records:

I am writing to formally request access to public records under the Freedom of Information Act (FOIA). Specifically, I am requesting any and all records and materials related to the case of

Suspect Name: geneva leal
Description/Headline: Woman sentenced to 20 years for role in 2017 Lubbock homicide
Link of the Article: https://eu.lubbockonline.com/story/news/coronavirus/2020/07/28/woman-sentenced-to-20-years-for-role-in-2017-lubbock-homicide/42494225/
State: texas
Law Enforcement: Lubbock Police Department

included but not limited to the following:
Documents:
Incident reports
Investigation reports
Officer statements
Witness statements
Any other relevant case files

Footage:
Body camera footage from officers on the scene
Dash camera footage
Police surveillance camera footage
Private/public surveillance footage from nearby locations
Any footage collected as evidence or during the investigation

Audio:
911 calls
Police radio communications
Any other audio recordings related to the case
Visual Media:
Crime scene photographs
Surveillance stills
Photographs taken during the investigation

Court Records:
Transcripts from court hearings or proceedings
Any video/audio footage from court hearings
Court orders or any other court-related documents

Please include any and all materials, regardless of format (digital or physical), including those not listed above that are related to the case in question.
Additionally, if this request has been sent to the wrong department or agency, I would appreciate it if you could provide guidance or contact information for the correct department or agency that handles such requests.

If any part of the request is denied or redacted, please provide a detailed explanation of the specific legal exemption that applies.
Thank you for your attention to this matter. I look forward to your timely response within the period mandated by FOIA.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 10 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

david yupa

Upload documents directly: https://accounts.muckrock.com/accounts/login/?next=https%3A%2F%2Fwww.muckrock.com%2Faccounts%2Flogin%2F%3Fnext%3D%252Faccounts%252Fagency_login%252Flubbock-police-department-5234%252Ffoia-request-for-case-related-materials-geneva-leal-179662%252F%253Femail%253Dorr%252540mylubbock.us&url_auth_token=AAAdfNnpF4FPPdoCvPXHKqh5ptc%3A1tXHHR%3AQFP40NaJk9E9x71u0AZObbWMgWUUD4ShEt33u30FrhU 
Your request will be forwarded to the relevant City of Lubbock department(s) to locate the information you seek and to determine the volume and any costs associated with satisfying your request. You will be contacted about the availability and/or provided with copies of the records in question. PLEASE NOTE: Chapter 552 of Texas Government Code, the Public Information Act does not require a governmental body to create new information, to do legal research, or to answer questions. 
You can monitor the progress of your request at the link below and you'll receive an email when your request has been completed. Again, thank you for using the Open Records Center. 
City of Lubbock

 Fees Charged: Recording Fee Each:  $70.00

title: Incel Course Materials

communications.subject: California Public Records Act Request: Incel Course Materials
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the California Public Records Act, I hereby request the following records:

Any course materials (including but not limited to course guides, syllabi, handouts, Powerpoints, slide shows, presentations, audio recordings, video recordings, and homework assignments) prepared for the trainings "Terrorism I: International Terrorism" held December 2024, "Terrorism II: Domestic Terrorism" held 14-15 January 2025, and "Terrorism III: Advanced Counter-Terrorism Strategies" held 4-5 February 2025. You may find fliers for these courses attached below.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 10 calendar days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Matthew Petti

title: Nick Hill 2020 Attempted Murder case

communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Maryland Public Information Act, I hereby request the following records:

all available records related to the case of Nick Hill, who was charged with attempted murder in May 2020. Specifically, I seek incident and arrest reports, charging documents, court records (including indictments, motions, and judgments), interrogation recordings or transcripts, evidence logs, witness statements, and any available video footage (e.g., body cam, dash cam, or surveillance). Please also include communications between law enforcement and prosecutors regarding this case. If any records are exempt from disclosure, please provide a detailed explanation for each exemption.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 10 calendar days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Ore Adebanjo
